CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 15, 1952, pg. 24, reads: "Pitt Stalwarts - Four good reasons why Pitt University has come up with the best grid team to show in Pittsburgh for a long time can be found in persons of, left to right, halfback, Chester Rice; fullback, Bobby Epps; quarterback, Henry Ford, and end, Bill Adams. Rice and Ford are first-string defensive backs, while Epps and Adams are starting offense players.  Pitt defeated Ohio State Saturday, 21-14, running their season's record to five wins and two losses. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Four University of Pittsburgh football players, from left: halfback Chester Rice, fullback Bobby Epps, quarterback Henry Ford, and end Bill Adams, posing on field
